skill.name: markdown-pro
skill.description: Professional Markdown documentation skill for creating polished README files, changelogs, contribution guides, and technical documentation. Use for: (1) README generation with badges and sections, (2) Automated changelog from git history, (3) Table of contents generation, (4) Contribution guidelines, (5) Technical documentation formatting, (6) Code documentation with syntax highlighting
skill.summary: Professional Markdown documentation skill for creating polished README files, changelogs, contributi...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate documentation skill with no malicious intent. All static scanner findings are false positives triggered by documentation patterns (code examples in markdown, placeholder API keys, shield badge URLs). The single Python script uses subprocess to run git log for changelog generation with hardcoded arguments, which is legitimate and documented behavior.

content.value_statement: Generate polished README files, changelogs, and technical documentation with proven templates and formatting patterns. Automate documentation workflows with built-in helper scripts.
actual_capabilities: Generate professional README files with badges, tables of contents, and code examples
Automatically create changelogs from git commit history using conventional commits format
Format technical documentation with syntax highlighting, collapsible sections, and alert boxes
Validate markdown links and generate table of contents from headers
Create contribution guidelines following open source best practices
limitations: Does not execute shell commands or modify external systems
Does not access or store credentials or API keys
Requires git repository for changelog generation feature
Helper scripts require Python 3.7+ for advanced automation features

use_cases.title: Professional Project Documentation
use_cases.description: Create polished README files and contribution guides that attract contributors and improve project accessibility.

use_cases.title: Automated Changelog Generation
use_cases.description: Generate maintainer-friendly changelogs automatically from git history using semantic versioning standards.

use_cases.title: API Documentation Templates
use_cases.description: Build consistent API reference documentation with code examples, parameter tables, and return value formats.

prompt_templates.title: Generate README
prompt_templates.prompt: Use markdown-pro to create a professional README for my project that includes badges, installation instructions, usage examples, and API documentation section.

prompt_templates.title: Create Changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a changelog in Keep a Changelog format from our git history since version 1.0.0. Include sections for Added, Changed, Fixed, and Breaking Changes.

prompt_templates.title: Write Contribution Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a CONTRIBUTING.md file with code of conduct, development setup instructions, commit message conventions, and pull request process.

prompt_templates.title: Format API Docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Format our API documentation using markdown-pro patterns with syntax highlighting, parameter tables, response examples, and error handling documentation.

output_examples.input: Create a professional README for my Python CLI tool
output: Generates header with shield badges for license, version, and build status
Includes table of contents with anchor links to all sections
Adds feature list with bold formatting for key benefits
Provides installation steps with pip and from-source options
Includes usage examples with syntax-highlighted code blocks
Adds API reference section with parameter documentation
Parses git commits using conventional commits format
Categorizes changes into Added, Fixed, Changed, and Breaking Changes
Formats output following Keep a Changelog standard
Includes PR numbers and author attribution where available

best_practices: Use clear, descriptive headers with consistent hierarchy (H1 for title, H2 for sections, H3 for subsections)
Include code examples with syntax highlighting for every major feature
Add badges for quick project status overview (license, version, build, coverage)
anti_patterns: Avoid bare URLs without descriptive link text
Do not mix heading styles or skip heading levels
Avoid generic project titles like 'My Project' without clear description

faq.question: Does this skill execute code on my system?
faq.answer: No. This is a documentation template skill. The helper scripts only generate markdown content and do not execute arbitrary commands.

faq.question: Can I use this with any git hosting platform?
faq.answer: Yes. Templates follow standard markdown patterns compatible with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and other platforms.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: All languages with markdown code block syntax highlighting. Templates include examples for Python, JavaScript, Bash, and YAML.

faq.question: Does the changelog feature work without git?
faq.answer: Changelog generation requires a git repository. Other documentation features work without git.

faq.question: Can I customize the templates?
faq.answer: Yes. All templates in the examples folder are starting points. Modify sections to match your project needs.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use in production environments?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads files and generates text output. It does not modify source code or access sensitive data.
